import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-document-page', templateUrl: './document-page.component.html', styleUrls: ['./document-page.component.css'], }) export class DocumentPageComponent implements OnInit { constructor() {} showDropdown: boolean = false; selectedLevel: number | null = null; shouldShowDiv: boolean = true; ngOnInit(): void {} toggleDropdown(): void { this.showDropdown = !this.showDropdown; } selectLevel(level: number): void { this.selectedLevel = level; this.showDropdown = false; } }

Candle stick Charting Guide

Anatomy of Candlesticks

This is a wider card with supporting text below as a natural lead-in to additional content. This content is a little bit longer.This is a wider card with supporting text below as a natural lead-in to additional content. This content is a little bit longer.This is a wider card with supporting text below as a natural lead-in to additional content. This content is a little bit longer.

Candle properties

Colour

• The colour is generally displayed as green and red candles.
• Green candles are bullish, closing higher than the open.t
• Red candles are bearish, closing lower than the open.

Body Size

• The body size represents the degree to which the bulls overcome the bers (green candle) or the bears overcome the bulls (red candle).
• A large body shows incresed commitment
• A small body shows reduced commitment.

Range

• The range of the candle is the distance from the high to the low, and represents the volatility of the price during the trading session.
• A wide range shows increased volatility
• A narrow range shows redused volatility

Shadow Loation

• Shadows above the real body show rejection of higher prices(selling).
• Shadows below the real body show rejection of lower prices(buying)
